intro: Seseli coloratum var. carvifolium, commonly known as the caraway-leaved seseli, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant features aromatic, finely cut leaves that resemble those of caraway, giving it its common name. Its small white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
